definitions.definition: the situation when a factory, school, hospital, etc. shuts permanently

examples.text: The hospital has been threatened with closure.
Spending cuts could mean the closure of the village school.
The factory is under threat of closure.
The mine has been saved from closure.

definitions.definition: the temporary closing of a road or bridge

examples.text: There will be road closures and diversions in the area from 8 p.m.
The accident caused the complete closure of the road.

definitions.definition: the feeling that a difficult or an unpleasant experience has come to an end or been dealt with in an acceptable way

examples.text: The conviction of their son's murderer helped to give them a sense of closure.
People who lose family members need closure, not false hope.

wordOrigin: late Middle English: from Old French, from late Latin clausura, from claus- ‘closed’, from the verb claudere.
